name: 1 - Concrete placed within 1 hour (conc. Temp<=32 degrees) or 45 mins (32>conc. temp < 35 degrees) from the time of charging the mixer unless a retardant is used and approved by the Administrator.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Temp <35 Continuous
2 - Design and erection of falsework, its founding, support and time, order and manner of release approved by the Administrator.
3 - No concrete placed until falsework, formwork, reinforcement and stressing materials inspected, foreign material removed from forms and equipment and placement procedures approved.
4 - Concrete operations shall not commence until all relevant procedures have been approved by the Administrator
5 - Administrator to be present for placement of concrete, with 24 hours notice.
6 - The placement of concrete underwater shall be carried out in the presence of the Administrator and shall comply with the requirements of Clause 19.2
7 - Concrete slump is within tolerance (AS 1379 table 6) of approved target slump.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Slump Test:
8 - Samples for testing taken as required - min 2 cylinders/sample
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - 1-3 Loads - Every Load

10 - Compaction of concrete commences immediately after deposition in accordance with approved procedures and equipment - minimum of two vibrators used with at least one per 4m3 of concrete placed per hour.
11 - Additional construction joints approved by Superintendent.
12 - Forms and Falsework not removed early unless approved by the Superintendent
○ Non-structural - min(50% of 28 day strength or 3 days)
○ Soffits of slabs, headstock and diaphragms - 7 days
○ Side forms of structural concrete - 2 days (Exposure class A), 3 days (B1, B2) or 5 days (Exposure class C)
14 - Forms removed with care and curing commence upon completion of finishing operations to approved procedures. If forms removed in under 7 days, curing commences within 1 hour
○ Fins and unwanted projections are ground off
○ Pockets and honeycombed areas repaired using approved methods
○ Where required in the drawings surfaces achieve class 1 finish or are bagged within 4 hours of stripping, then cured
16 - Concrete installed to within positional, dimensional and relative tolerances. Should a specified tolerance be exceeded, the work shall be liable to rejection.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Visual <Specified MRTS70 Cl22 QR-CTS-Part 7
17 - Acceptance or Rejection of Hardened Concrete
b) < Fc (Ave 3 consecutive samples from Lot)
c) > 1.4 Fc (Ave 3 consecutive samples from Lot)
d) < 0.5 (Fc+Ft) (10 or more samples for Class of concrete in 4 consecutive weeks)
